item.title: Digital garden
item.description: A digital garden is a place for thoughts, knowledge and ideas to grow. The main reference for what a digital garden is comes from Maggie Appleton. I will not follow the original ethos to the T, but it’s a very nice read nonetheless. For me, the main pull towards maintaining a digital garden is that it’s not as intensive as a blog. As outlined in Maggie’s writing, a blog requires you to do all of this background research before eventually deciding to release a perfectly manicured opinion to the internet, exerting your intellectual authority onto all who pass through your site.
